result.execSummary:
The defendant Cal W Kieffer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Apply 5 days sentence credit, if revoked.

miscConds.notes:
Court costs and DNA surcharge are to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.
AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit to random urine screens.
No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
Attend Koinonia Impatient Facility and complete program and follow through with any recommendations made.

timeConds.notes:
STAYED.
To be used at Agent's discretion and Agent to determine with or without non working hours.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Cal W Kieffer

Court finds defendant guilty. Defendant Cal W Kieffer in court, in custody, with attorney Patrick J. Hudec.   Kevin Michael Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty.  Count #2 is dismissed and read in.  The Defense reserves its right to appeal.  BAIL MONEY TO BE REFUNDED TO POSTER.  The Defendant was given the following:

COUNT #1:

WITHHELD SENTENCE;

TERM OF PROBATION:  2 YEARS; (APPLY 5 DAYS CREDIT IF REVOKED)

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
*AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
*Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
*No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
*No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
*Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
*Inform Agent of all prescriptions
*Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
*Maintain full time employment and/or combination of schooling 
*DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done.
*Perform 100 hours community service.
*Attend Koinonia Impatient Facility and Complete Program and follow through with any recommendations made. 

COURT COSTS:  $268.00 (to be paid as a condition of probation); (BAIL MONEY TO BE RETUNED TO POSTER)

DNA SURCHARGE:  $250.00 (to be paid as a condition of probation); (BAIL MONEY TO BE RETURNED TO POSTER)

CONDITION TIME: 30 DAYS, STAYED; to be used at agent's discretion.  Agent to determine with or without non working hours.  

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
